value:
The look on someone's face after
being summoned is priceless.
Such bewilderment!

My liege is Lady Hinoka—a woman
of many marvels. I never tire of
basking in her glow!

It's nice that you look after us, but
you needn't tire yourself. We of flesh
and bone are either alive...or not.

I sense you're troubled by deep
thoughts. Glad to help. Let's partake
in shallow conversation!

Do I spend time praying? Never.
It's like throwing crumbs to the
wind—with no birds in sight.

I bear a load of hellos from
$Nf!$k$pGlad to be little more than a
mule in this situation.

Strength is fleeting, but I really
do enjoy this.
Oh, how lovely. Praise Hotoke.

Ha! Little or nothing! That's life,
in a nutshell.

Oh my! It's like a brisk wind,
ruffling my robes!

I'm the monk Azama from Hoshido.
How odd, being summoned! I'll give
you a hand, as long as I'm here.

Ah, it is you! I should have known
from the ever-busy pitter-pat of
your footsteps.$k$pYou must have far too much
free time on your hands if you're
always spending it with me.$k$pWhy, who am I to deserve it?
I'm just a holy man, not worth
even the time of day.$k$pNow, speaking of free time,
do you plan to ever free me of
my time here with you?$k$pI mean, of course, final release.
The good-bye. The farewell.
The ta-ta and toodle-oo!$k$pI shouldn't let myself be
troubled by the idea that we'd
be separated.$k$pBut I've grown fond of you.
I'd like to give you more
of my time, not less.$k$pSo please, don't give me any of
that sort of free time—not for
years and years. All right?
はっ
せいっ
ぐあっ！
My...just reward...
I won't lose!
Here comes your final reward.
Death comes for everyone.
Rest in peace.
No regrets...
A ha ha
Do be careful.
What to do with you?
I assure you, I am a devoted monk. But devotion takes many forms.
Worrying? Suffering? No, no, no. Let's not waste any time on that.
Heavenly vistas? People dressed in white? It's almost like...we've passed to the other side.
Where is my Lady Hinoka? She does scourge me so if I don't come running.
Summoning? Forcing poor souls to fight? Ghastly. But also quite whimsical, so count me in!
Yes?
Well, well.
If we must.
